item.title: Theresa add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "And the Grinch, with his Grinch-feet ice cold in the snow, stood puzzling and puzzling, how could it be so? It came without ribbons. It came without tags. It came without packages, boxes or bags. And he puzzled and puzzled 'till his puzzler was sore. Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before. What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas, perhaps, means a little bit more." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Theresa add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If you look for perfection, you'll never be content." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Theresa add a quote by Arthur Miller
item.description: "Just remember, kid, you can quicker get back a million dollars that was stole than a word that you gave away." -- Arthur Miller

item.title: Theresa add a quote by James Dean
item.description: "I'd rather have people hiss than yawn." -- James Dean
